intro: Crotalaria melanocalyx, commonly known as the black-flowered crotalaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. The plant is characterized by its striking dark purple to black flowers, which are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Crotalaria melanocalyx is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique and striking floral display.
